FuncDef:
The dns-server command binds a DNS server to an IPv6 address pool by an IPv6 address.
The undo dns-server command deletes the binding between a DNS server and an IPv6 address pool.
By default, a DNS server is not bound to an IPv6 address pool by an IPv6 address.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of a DNS server.
The address is a 32-digit hexadecimal number.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Through this command specifies a DNS server for users allocated IP addresses in a specified address pool.
A maximum of two DNS servers can be bound to an IPv6 address pool by IPv6 addresses.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
